Reviews.Title: “Good enough but more for the younger crowd.”
Reviews.Author: CherylNS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last 2 nights of an extended stay in Turkey. The hotel is in a great location and I was delighted to find that it was easy walking distance to the pedestrian mall which provided lots of entertainment day and night. The room views are not to be missed and the mid century modern decor is pleasing. My bathroom could have used a bit of work. Funky grout in the tub area is always a little off putting not to mention the outrageously thigh high sides on the tub which you have to climb over to take a shower. Challenging and risky for the not so young. The bar scene on Saturday night was quite frisky and loud but mild by the neighborhood standards. A neighboring rooftop bar/restaurant was blaring music until the wee hours each night. Young professionals and the young an heart will find this desirable. Me, not so much

Reviews.Title: “Chain hotel - but lovely receptionist (Erdem?) and breakfast and Mikla restaurant”
Reviews.Author: arderne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute due to a BA flight cancellation. We had been told we could book any five star hotel. We wanted to return to our original hotel, Empress Zoe, which was wonderful, but at the last minute found out my daughter had to work and needed a room of her own and fast internet. We were able to get two interconnecting rooms (612 and 614) - actually with a little corridor in between the rooms. Not particularly good view from the room but OK - rooms very clean and reasonable with very reasonable bathrooms. The receptionist who took our booking and dealt with us was one of the best parts of the stay. He organised late check out for us as we had had so much trouble on BA and this was terrific. He was generally extremely helpful and actually made the whole experience much better and nicer.. We also thought the breakfast was lovely and the restaurant - Mikla was terrific. The queue to check in and check out was understaffed though and I think it would be a great improvement if the hotel could get more staff - the staff did their best but it was very difficult for them If you want a reasonably priced hotel in Pera this is a perfecctly acceptable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great first impression”
Reviews.Author: Elias A
Reviews.Content: I did not have an extensive experience at this hotel, but they managed to make a positive first impression. Although I only stayed few hours at this hotel, my attention was struck by the staff's friendliness and professionalism. Check-in and check-out procedures were smooth, although reception were extremely busy, multitasking on many fronts. The room was bright, and comfortably large. The bathroom on the other hand is a bit small, looks old and has a yellowish light. The bathtub is also a bit tight. The hotel has a great location, from which you can easily reach Istiklal street. Additionally, you can easily grab a cab and reach other main attractions in few minutes. If I visit Istanbul again, I'll definitely consider staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice staff, awesome rooftop.”
Reviews.Author: TarjeiH
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 days before Easter. Rooms are small, clean and stylish. Halls and reception classy, nice staff. Breakfast had an excellent selection of food, but the eating area could be pretty noisy. Very close to the shopping and night-life district, and within easy walkingdistance (we'll, we're Norwegian and pretty used to walking) to the old city. Good bar/restaurant on the 18th floor with an awesome view, both in the daytime and at night. Rooftop pool was not open during our visit. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dazerc
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week and the hotel was in a great location close to the predestian area and close to all the restaurants. The room was small but very clean and an excellent view over the city. The batroom was small but had a good shower and a large mirror even a mirror on the ceiling. I only visited the hotel breakfast bar but it was always well stocked with a good selection of food. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful even when I arrived extreamly late (6am) so missed my first nights stay but just in time for a shower and breakfast before starting work. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great option to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: Ercole_Shanghai
Reviews.Content: I attended a business meeting here and the hotel was fully supporting. Great wifi connection everywhere indeed and excellent quality and quantity of food for breakfast and lunch. For leasure the hotel is perfectly located very close to the main pedestrian street in Pera side of the city with walking distance to many attractions and restaurants. Very good service. Great option to enjoy Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel for Business & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Malim27
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights on a rate a third of what is usually charged. For the money I piad, I was very happy with the Pera. It well located close to main shopping area and restaurants and not too far from Taksim Square. Lobby a bit small, but no problem. Rooms again ok but small bathrooms and poor A/C. Not sure how good the AC would work at the height of summer. Bar area and restaurant fine. Loads of taxis outside - reliable and cheap. The jewel in this hotels' crown is the restaurant and bar on the top floor. This place would not look out of place in Manhattan. Very swish and superb food. Note however, you will Manhattan-like prices for alcohol (wonderful cocktails) and food. The views from here are simply breath taking! If you don't stay here, come for a beer and the view, especially at sunset. I've been around (Cape Town, Rio, NY, Tokyo etc) but this view is something else - seeing two continents (Asia and Europe) come together at twilight is wonderful. If you plan to visit Sultanhamet, Topkapi, Blue Mosque etc. stay on the other side of the river. If you want to shop and eat out...this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Greatv Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chant13
Reviews.Content: Clean, ideal location and very friendly staff! We landed at 4am and by the time we got to the Hotel at 5:30 we were so tired. I had emailed the hotel in advance asking them for an early check in and as we got there they accommodated us into a great room (but they changed us to a king size as we requested later) at no additional price! They were helpful with practically everything! We would def stay there again! Also, the price was decent for a 4 star Hotel like that! The staff were also helpful with TAxi drivers. You need to be very careful with drivesr; take their registration number always. Some are very cunning and will steal money from tourists without even blinking and you will NTO realize until later. Be careful: 5lira and 50 lira look similar so check what you give them and what they give you back. Look at the condition of your notes when you give them money and do not accept broken ones from them (they have this trick where they say they cannot accept the note but they are basically giving you back a fake). By booking taxis at the hotel we avoided issues as they always go there to pick up tourists and the consierge make sure the drives goes to the right places without the turn around Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Cypriot_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and recommend it for its nice restaurant, location, hygiene and welcoming atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good convenient comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danny03
Reviews.Content: Apart from the price which can be high (I was fortunate to get a good rate through a friend and it was in the midst of the winter), the hotel is right up there on convenience and comfort. My stay included breakfast which was a sumptuous buffet each morning with a half dozen types of cheese, breads (may be a dozen types), egg, cold meat (several), cereal (again several). It is also less than 50 meters from Isteklal Street (Istanbul's Champs-ElysÃ©es). Taxis are easily available (But why take one when the funicular to the trams is perhaps just a 200 meters walk). The hotel is also quieter than the other Marmaras (there are three so if you have a guest visiting you do clearly mention the one you are staying at. The busier one is Marmara Taksim but more than 2 Kms away). What can the hotel do better? Maybe more points in the lobby for charging laptops etc. And just in case,you decide to take a break from the sightseeing, the rooms also have a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Istanbul, nice views”
Reviews.Author: ItsAllAGame
Reviews.Content: Price was quite high, but that's Istanbul for you. Breakfast was decent, nothing spectacular. Good overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: PaulPan
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended for the business travel, great location close to Taxim, good breakfast, extremely friendly and accommodating service. Clean but not immaculately so.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best view of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: arabaci
Reviews.Content: One of the best view of Istanbul. The reception ( Murat Yildizsafer ) the employees attitude and services. price feeling of hospitality free available WiFi in the room! i am coming back to this hotel for sure

Reviews.Title: “2 day stay for business”
Reviews.Author: Valeri_Odikadze
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, very good quality of personal, room, equipment and food. Warm personal. Feel like in home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Amm91
Reviews.Content: Very good service, Murat at the front desk was very helpful and friendly, pretty good views, awesome rooftop bar. Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: meanchat
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels in Istanbul. The rooms are bright, the Internet works well, the beds are comfortable and there is a great rooftop pool with spectacular views of the city. The Marmara Pera is centrally located to lively Istiklal street, the Pera museum, the Galata district, Cukurcuma antique district and even the old city is within walking distance, if you like to walk a couple of miles, that is. The front desk staff was helpful in securing a room with a nice view overlooking the Golden Horn. The breakfast spread is decent, served in the lobby restaurant and there is a swanky restaurant (Mikla) on the top floor of the hotel, again with awesome views. This is not the most luxurious hotel in the city (the Pera Palace Hotel is across the street at 3x the price); however, if you want a nice bright room and a great location in a modern hotel, I highly recommend this place. One thing to be careful about if you are booking online is to make sure that you have the right hotel. There is another Marmara in Taksim, about a mile away that is about twice the price. also, there are a bunch of other hotels with the name Pera, so if booking through a consolidator, make certain it is the Marmara Pera. I found out the hard way once and ended up in an awful motel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful journey”
Reviews.Author: Antonio G
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time during our journey at Marmara Pera hotel. It's very well located, great for walking and shopping at the Istiklal Cad. Great service, great breakfast!! Armand was wonderful, we will defenately come back, eather for business or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Isanbul”
Reviews.Author: CairoKhalil
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 2 times last one was 2 weeks ago , very good location , nice view , very helpful staff , clean rooms , I recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Really happy”
Reviews.Author: richdarwin
Reviews.Content: we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.Accommodation was very good. service and view great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Flos_travels
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul for a week as a romantic getaway combined with New Year's celebrations with friends. The staff at the hotel did their very best to make this a lovely time; we were given a very warm welcome and late check-in was not a problem. The room was a good size with a lovely view. Nice little bathroom which was kept very clean along with the room. Very comfortable bed and the room also had a table and chair which were very useful and more than what is available at other local hotels. The location of the hotel is perfect for making the most of Istiklal St and its restaurants, shops and clubs without being bothered by the noise and bustle. It is also located next to a big taxi rank which is perfect for any other trips and access to the airport. The staff were very polite, friendly and helpful and spoke good English, which was a great improvement on previous stays in Istanbul. All-in-all very happy with the stay, and we will be returning to this hotel for sure on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: shanghaimarkus
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in December for 3 nights. The hotel is in a great location, the staff makes you feel home immediately. I had a great room with a nice view, the rooms were very clean, bathroom is nice. The staff at the reception tried their best to make my stay unforgettable, offered my great restaurant options and pointed out with sights are the most interesting to visit. Next time I will stay there again, no question at all.

Reviews.Title: “Only worth it for location and view from top floor”
Reviews.Author: m c
Reviews.Content: First impressions of our rooms was very disappointing. They were supposed to be non-smoking but one of them stank of old smoke (and even had some ash on the bedroom chair). Badly lit bedroom with only one chair and bedside light on one side of the bed so very difficult to read, even just the guidebook and map. Breakfast was excellent and all waiters were friendly and went out of their way to make sure you had everything you needed. Sadly the same was not true of the reception staff who were rude, dismissive and difficult. In our four day stay our room key cards were diabled EVERY DAY and when we took them down to be reset wwe were told each time that it was OUR fault and all four key cards must have been near cellphones! They also quoted the price for the room in Euros but then used THEIR OWN exchange rate to covert it to their own currency which was incredibly unrealistic. On top of that, the gym stank of sewers, was 27 degrees and never had any water. Sadly it is in a great location with a pretty view from the top floor, but I am sure you could find somewhere better to stay in the wonderful Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Astonishing view”
Reviews.Author: Sberla84
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the 10th floor, Golden Horn view room: astonishing! The hotel is well positioned in the city, easily reachable with taxi or by foot. Rooms are well equipped and clean, you can have your bed linen changed every day if you feel the need. The staff at welcome desk is friendly and kind. Some minor issues in our room during the first day :burned out light bulb, missing toilet brush (not solved). Breakfast was fair, good selection and variety. I would recommend fresh orange juice instead of the one we were offered.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING view”
Reviews.Author: Annika T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends for Christmas this year. We splurged on the junior suite and were so happy. The view was breathtaking and the amenities were great. The front desk gave out free Christmas cookies, and they were also really accommodating of our schedules --letting us check in early and check out late because of ferry times. When we tried to hook our computers up to the HUGE flat screens, some technicians came to help...even at 2 in the morning. :-) The location is perfect--just off of Istiklal, in the heart of Istanbul's going-out neighborhood. It's close to great shopping, restaurants and night clubs. If you've got the money, I'd say it's definitely worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “A great restaurant and breathtaking view from bar”
Reviews.Author: tarynpeter
Reviews.Content: Spent my last night in Istanbul having dinner at the top of the Hotel. Twilight view was spectacular! The food and service was outstanding. Pricy, but worth it. Can' t wait to go back! The rooftop pool was a little larger than a hottub, and the lounge was beautiful. Nice wine selection too.

Reviews.Title: “Rania's home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: relbakry
Reviews.Content: The Marmara Pera is such a pleasant surprise for someone who does not know what to expect. With its contemporary design on the inside and within tiny walking distance to Istiklal street, it boasts one of the best views of Istanbul. Nice, clean, neat rooms with impeccably clean bathrooms. Housekeeping staff are friendly and will leave you needing nothing. Brilliant and fresh breakfast with great coffee and tea. Friendly staff who speak English fluently and are eager to help and make your experience close to perfect. Very good value for money. I would always advise a golden horn veiw room because the view is priceless..the higher your floor the better. If you find yourself missing the view, stop by the rooftop bar/restaurant, it is a popular spot and you will not want to leave. Opt for this one not the Taksim one, it is close enough to all the lively areas without being noisy or overbearing. I would stay there again and again and one more time for good measure. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: Gruch
Reviews.Content: The Marmara Pera is a great location in the bohemian area of Beyoglu which boasts some of the best restaurants in Istanbul. The rooms are a good size and well appointed and very clean. The upper rooms at the back have a great view of the Bosphorus. The front rooms have a city view which is great for city watching. The views from the roof top bar and pool are probably the best in Istanbul. The service and staff are excellent. The hotel is conveniently located close to the metro which makes getting to the major business districts pain free and it is easy to get to the old city, Sultanahmet, by taking the historic Tunel funicular railway and the tram.

Reviews.Title: “perfect perfect perfect great!!!”
Reviews.Author: YasBerry
Reviews.Content: amazingly clean .. amazing view amazing internet (free) service amazing staff amazing rooftop pool with rooftop lounge and rooftop bar! did i say amazing? yes! i will definitly stay here again! never felt so safe in the crazy city Istanbul especially a block away from TAKSIM! Istiklal Street! try the rooftop mojitos! amazing:) they should change the name to "amazing hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but the airco...”
Reviews.Author: EllesP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in the hippest area of Istanbul; Beyoglu. The rooftop bar/terrace is a plus (but expensive, 7 euro for a glass of their cheapest wine). But the views are awsome, so it's well worth paying this money. And the small swimming pool is an extra bonus. The rooms are small, but funny en trendy decorated with a view,..wow! The airco was basically the only extreme negative point from our stay. It just did not work properly. The hotel was fully booked and we think the airco could not handle blowing cold air in all the rooms. We were given (no trouble, very politely) another room, but the problem was the same. For a hotel in this price category we were actually very disappointed. Because of the heat we haven't slept well for 4 nights. The breakfast was fantastic, mmmm still thinking of it. Never saw so many items and variety. Tumbs up! The staf is not only nice, some of the reception girls are gorgeous looking :-) Would we return, yes...but fix the airco please!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lovely roof top view”
Reviews.Author: winbill
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with great decor, friendly staff and an amazing roof top view. Good value for money (we booked direct and got a better rate than that advertised). Would really recommend this place - hard to find a city hotel that ticks all the boxes but this one did for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great view from the roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: TTK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 3 nights and really liked the hotel. We had a room on the 7th floor which had a great view. The roof terrace is great with fab views of the city. There is a small pool and sundeck as well as a bar area. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a great location for bars and restaurants. Our only slight gripe was that some of the furniture in the room was a bit shabby. However the room was very tastefully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, helpful reception”
Reviews.Author: TobyInTransit
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a holiday in Istanbul. Location is great, just off the main street for shopping, eating etc. We had an awful smell in the room when we first checked in, coming from the shower drain. After one night they moved us to another room on a higher floor which had better views. Breakfast is great, with lots of choices of hot food and drinks. It might be quite busy as there seems to be conventions and tour groups staying here. There is a bit of traffic in front of the hotel and can be a bit noisy at times (but this is quite normal in Istanbul which is a very busy city).

Reviews.Title: “A first class hotel conveniently located in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: earainold3
Reviews.Content: There is a wonderful rooftop restaurant and bar with a great view, particular at sunset; and at night when the nearby Acropolis illuminated. The room was very comfortable; and the staff and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I'm repeat guest at the Marmara Pera”
Reviews.Author: themarketingtourist
Reviews.Content: Centrally located near the fun and pictoresque streets in central shopping as well as cultural area. Spacious and newly renovated rooms, informal atmosphere, GREAT ROOF TOP BAR AND RESTURANT (Mikla) WITH THE BEST VIEW IN ISTANBUL.

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT HOTEL FOR YOUR HOLIDAYS IN ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: AntonioAN
Reviews.Content: Located 5 minutes from Taksim square, this hotel has very good service in all aspects. Clean, spacius and modern rooms with nice views, very complete breakfast and we had a nice wellcome with a fruit plate and a bottle of wine. I was in August 2011 with 5 friends more and all of them are also very pleased with the accommodation. Thank you very much for all. Antonio

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: LordPippo
Reviews.Content: Great view if you're at high floors. Check-in: quick and effective Room: good furniture but quite small. Huge screen window with a breathtaking view on the Bosphorus: definitely a great point! Bathroom: bit small but clean and complete Breakfast: wide buffet with another gorgeous view of Istanbul and the strait. Good solutions for business trip and, I believe, for short vacations too Remeber to ask for highest floors!

Reviews.Title: “Money stolen from room”
Reviews.Author: Carmelle L
Reviews.Content: When I got to the hotel my friend had already been there for a week and was leaving the next day. She told me that she thought she was missing money from the safe, despite having used a personal code. She had not reported it to the hotel as she was not 100 % sure; as we do in that kind of situation she began to doubt herself, but she mentioned it to me so that I did not use the safe myself. In light of this I kept my money in a small bag, hidden in the inside pocket of my holdall. There was money in a few different currencies (as I had been travelling quite a bit), including 80Euro. On my second to last day, when I started packing I noticed that the 80Euro was gone. I complained to the hotel and was advised that they would, 'Look into the matter'. They never got back to me and as I knew I would not get my money back I did not pursue the matter further. I also mentioned the money my friend had lost as it seems obvious that they have a serious problem. When I got home I sent them an email about the matter and was advised that they were not responsible for my loss as I should have used the safe. My money was well hidden, so obviously the person was rooting through my belongings, which I do not expect. I have traveled extensively in the past, staying in youth hostels and budget hotels all over the world and have NEVER had money stolen from my room before. I was very very shocked and certainly would not be back. Besides this the photographs taken of the hotel pool are incredibly deceptive! They make it look as thought it stretches the entire length of the roof, but actually it is tiny. Not really possible to swim in at all! Deception and dishonesty seems to be rife at The Pera. Don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel located in Beyolu shoping area”
Reviews.Author: Eric46
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. Rooms are typically Istanbul "small sized" but have a nice trendy interiour and a nice big bed. Shame the bed had two separate matrasses which were on weels that could not be locked hence you end of with a lot of space between the two matrasses. The rooftop area is beautifully setup with a nice modern lounching area. This area allows a scenic view over the Bosorus and Beyoglu. The pool is much smaller than you would expect from the hotel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room and good location”
Reviews.Author: Blackpearl99
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for tourists. There are also many bars, clubs and restaurants around the corner. The room was ok, but rather small, in particular the bathroom. The shower cannot be closed so that the bathroom floor becomes wet. Wifi was free and very fast. Breakfast buffet offered a wide range of food and was good. The restaurant on the top is excellent, not cheap though. The view is awesome! The price of the room was not very cheap but not expensive neither considering the location close to Istiklal caddesi and Taksim.

Reviews.Title: “good experience.”
Reviews.Author: ArancinoNYC
Reviews.Content: Decent room, with amazing views (but dirty windows!). Functional bathroom. Friendly service. Decent wifi. Great location. We paid extra for a high floor with a view, but (almost) worth it! Paid about 130 EUR - not bad considering the season! FANTASTIC terrace on the top floor with a smallish pool - well worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: haresh64
Reviews.Content: Marmara Pera was our first hotel experience in Turkey and what a pleasant surprise it turned out to be. Their hotel rooms are well set, not the biggest but then again it may be because of space constraints of Istanbul. What the hotel lacked in terms of room size it made up with excellent service especially Ilhan at the front office and location. He went out of his way to make us feel extremely special. I will come back to Marmara Pera for the service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kamery7
Reviews.Content: It is greatly located in the middle of all the action in Istambul. If you are lucky enough to have a room located in the upper floors you are going to be able to see most of the fascinating view over the city but also all the way to the Bosphorus and even be able to see Asia and Europe from your window. And is located next to the super famous Marmara Palace Hotel were The Orient Express was filmed Rooms and beds are comfortable and it seems it went under renovation in order to make it look like one of those art/ boutique hotels--- a really beautiful bathroom... no bathtub just a shower but it worked for me. The only real problen I faced and it did all around Turkey is that AC doesn't work properly anywhere... other than that, okay, and wish is not too hot or too cold cause you won't have too much room for options.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saspur
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul for business and stayed at Pera for 3 nights. Average hotel, decent location. Standard rooms are quite small, however pretty expensive. I had a view to the city, not to Bosporus. It is very noisy outside due to traffic and night life and room windows must be closed for the night. Again the hotel location is quite convenient - 5 euro by taxi to grand bazaar or to most popular mosques. Breakfast was too basic and too much Turkish type.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seyyah
Reviews.Content: Mine was a ministay in this hotel. Room was comfortable and silent. There is spectacular view worth to pay the difference to see Halic- Golden Horn. Breakfast is also delicious with many varieties. Staff is always helpful. A large establishment as the Marmara Pera needs a beauty saloon in the hotel eg a coiffeur. It's not easy to find a proper place around.

Reviews.Title: “The Marmara Pera after renovation”
Reviews.Author: MustaphaEido
Reviews.Content: It is for sure a very nice hotel , near Beyoglu . I stayed at this hotel many times ( since 2006 or 2007) for 6 or more times . and this is the second time this year since the renovation (which I haven't seen much changes ) anyway this hotel has a very good receptionists I will mention the best whom I found the excellent and the most efficient and nicest well mannered one , his name is Mr Murat Yildizsafer .He was so helpful without wasting time when I asked for changing my room to a better view room which I always get at the Marmara Pera .. I highly recommend this hotel for the nice rooms and the best staff from security to bell boy to receptionist to house keeping to restaurant and all (sorry if I forgot anyone ) I will defiantly choose this hotel for its excellent staff and feeling at home .

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, best view, friendly stuff, and finest location”
Reviews.Author: erdincbektas
Reviews.Content: Location is great, and Ä± liked the rooms and the views, Food is unbelievable... the stuff very friendly, and smile 24 hours a day The staff from start to end are always at hand offering their superior service; and cannot do enough for you running around at high speed to meet your needs :) Rooms were getting cleaned everyday properly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service - Avoid”
Reviews.Author: youngUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a city break with my family. Emailed the hotel to enquire about upgrades 2 months prior to the holiday - no reply. After checking in we decided to book a private day tour of Istanbul for the following day - it arrived 1 hour late and cost the three of us Â£85 each. We enquired about a local hamam and were given the wrong directions. After failure to find the place we went back to the hotel and enquired about the same treatment at the sister hotel (Marmara Takism) and was quoted 50 TL just for entry - this wasn't the case when we arrived and it was actually free. The hotel had also booked me' in for the wrong massage. At the Marmara Taksim my massage was accompanied by a pneumatic drill on the floor directly above me. For the whole hour. On returning to the hotel that night I was awokened at 7am by cigarette smoke choking me as it leaked through the connecting doors with next door. I called downstairs but no action was taken for 10mins. I called again since my asthma was getting worse and opening the windows was letting the heavy traffic noise....somebody came up and said they would move me' to a different room-but no action was taken. When I complained later that morning I was told that although my room clearly had smoke in it, and that next door seemed as though they had been smoking, the guest next door said that he hadn't and therefore no further action could be taken. Communication with staff was very difficult and customer service throughout was very poor. Only the baggage porter seemed to show some remorse. All in all a v poor experience let down by poor management and lack of customer service training.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale, very nice staff, but some daytime rebuilding”
Reviews.Author: seacliffer_1011
Reviews.Content: The Marmara Pera is ideally located for shopping, restaurants and access to all parts of the city. The Tunel station is right around the corner, which gets you to a block from the tram stop to the old city, so it's fun and easy to travel to and from the hotel to all parts of the city. There are many top restaurants within walking distance, as is Taksim, Iskital Caddesi and all that offers, plus, right around the corner, great music shops where you can get traditional and new instruments. The staff at the hotel is very nice and speaks English, and the breakfast buffet is very good. The only small problem was that the hotel (as of early April) was undergoing some internal renovations, so there was some buzzing and hammering going on during the midday hours, but that may be done by the time you get there (check with them) and besides, why stay in your room during the day anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: PeterCG
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be coming to the end of a big renovation project and the renovated rooms and the lobby/bar area are smart and well furnished, and the staff are efficient and helpful. The hotel is just a few minutes' walk from Istiklal, the busy shopping, restaurant and nightlife street that seems to be the best place to hang around when not sightseeing. It's definitely much better to stay in this district, Beyoglu, and to take the tram to Sultanahmet, the touristy zone where the Topkapi Palace, Ayia Sofia, etc, are located. The restaurants in particular are much better around Istiklal than in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: HotelImpressions
Reviews.Content: Could be a better experience. the rooms were substandard, breakfast was average. Noisy renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yuriNYC
Reviews.Content: First off, The staff at the hotel was great. A friend left her iphone in a cab we took from the hotel first thing in the morning and we just surrendered to the fact that it's gone. When we got back to the hotel 6 hours later we, on an off chance, mentioned it to the front desk asked if there's any chance of finding the cab (we had neither the cab number nor name of driver so this was completely shot in the dark). We expected a polite apology saying they couldn't do anything without more info ut to our surprise they called the morning manager, who had logged every cab and where the guest went, they tracked down the driver and by the time we returned that evening from dinner the iphone was at reception waiting for us. In a city that is so chaotic this was finding a needle in a haystack and yet the staff acted as if this was a piece of cake. In regards to the rooms, they're well appointed if not a bit cliche. Living in NYC we have become jaded to modern design else where in the world. The only caveat with the rooms is it's not worth spending the money on the Golden Horn view rooms mainly because they are 30% more expensive and 30% smaller. Be warned that the roof top bar is the latest hot spot in Istanbul and that coming back at night you'll see a mass congregation of people waiting to get in. This doesn't affect hotel guests but it may put some people off. Nice perk that the hotel includes free wireless internet which worked very well during our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Rugged edges but great location”
Reviews.Author: sarne
Reviews.Content: 4 stars? Well, not in my book. We stayed, nov 3-7, in rom 202. Corridor outside the room needed a paint job added by something that could get the damp smell away. Beds in the room were okay. But..., one bedtable was semi-broken, different lamps for each bed with bad lightning, table at window was woobling, lamp over this table was had semi broken plastics. Cleaning of the room meant that the beds were made, bathroom somewhat cleaned. But..., small items wasn't noticed by the cleaning staff. The room had great view - you could see for miles. Pera Palace was straight opposite the street below. The hotel had a terrace on the roof where you could see for more miles. But no roof top service, no bar. Breakfast was okay. Reception friendly and helpful. Location was great. Turn right and right out of the hotel, then left at the Brasserie retaturant and you are up smack in the middle of the night life in this district.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtan08
Reviews.Content: We booked the Marmara for a three-night stay and it well-exceeded our expectations. The location was great - just minutes away from the bustling Istiklal Caddesi, which eventually leads to Taksim Square. Although most of the historical sites are in the Sultanahmet area, a taxi ride to get you across the bridge won't cost too much. The staff were also extremely helpful and accommodating, allowing us to check-in early and provide great restaurant recommendations. I would definitely stay here again if I returned for work or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient to Taksim given other options in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: alison2216
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and a good location if you want lots of variety in restaurants near Taksim Square. It's very central for that, but not so central if you want to go to the major sites (the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, etc.) For those you might want to stay in the old city. The hotel is really good about getting cabs, and the breakfast, while not a bargain, is a nice way to start the day. Hotel staff is extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Super location--more than adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: blakkkobera
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is brilliant--2 minute walk to Istiklal street, the pedestrian zone peppered with bars, restaurants and nightlife. 10 minutes walk to Takshim square. I had a room with the city view--95 euro--the sea view rooms were more expensive.The medium size room was clean and had a flatscreen TV, full bar and a safe. Breakfast (included in the tarriff), was lavish, with many varieties of fruit, meat, cheese, bread, juice, eggs, cereals and tea/coffee. The check in was fast, but the bell services and housekeeping took their own time. I would have given the hotel 4 stars, but was tricked by their billing system which left a sour taste. They quoted the rate in Euros and then made the bill in Turkish Lira--I paid in Euro, but they showed payment in Lira on the bill, and reconverted at a different rate from that which they used to convert the first time. Lost 5 Euro in the process-not a big amount, but a trick you would expect more from a taxi driver than a hotel of this stature.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice rooms, ok in general”
Reviews.Author: florenciamartinezs
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel, at first when I entered I thought it old, because the lobby is a bit old, but when I entered the room I canged my mind. The rooms are modern, confortable beds, bathrooms are ok. The bar in the terrace on the top floor hass a igreat view. Nicely located in a central area and some nice restaurants and bars around. All in all, a nice pic.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: ollielollie
Reviews.Content: Located in an area where the buzz is amazing. Rooftop bar has unique view over Istanbul. Faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start off a trip to Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Zoyenka
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul 3 days before my Turkey tour started, stayed in a quaint old wooden hotel in Sultanahmet, then transferred to the Marmara Pera. Must say that both hotel experiences were unique, but the Marmara Pera surpassed the former in comfort and services. Excellent bed, most excellent breakfast but mediocre dinner, excellent internet facilities (FREE) which worked most of the time, and pleasant, English-speaking staff. Hotel's proximity to Istiklal Caddesi and Tunel is superb, as well as the fact that it is right across the street from the historic Pera palace. Close to night life, good restaurants and seems to be a taxi hub, so transportation around the city was a breeze. Not sure I could afford to stay here without being on a tour, but for a business traveler, it is a most comfortable, convenient choice. Kudos to my tour group (Grand Circle Travel) for having chosen this as our jumping off spot.

Reviews.Title: “A Satisfying Experince....”
Reviews.Author: Merchant1965
Reviews.Content: This is a slightly high end hotel on the Pera side{Near Taksim Square} which according to me is the better side to live in as compared to the Sultanamet Area. The hotel has lots and lots of eating joints and bars, all walking distance. The hotel is quite classy, the rooms are spacious, the staff was extremely friendly and courteous, we were on the upper floors so cud get a great sight of Istanbul City. Breakfast was limited. Night life around this place rocks though for all the sightseeing one has to go to the Sultanamet Area which is not really far.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful way to kick off our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JLen717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I choose Turkey for our Honeymoon destination. We cannot say enough good things about the hotel. We loved our room overlooking Golden Horn. The staff is excellent. The rooftop pool was a nice way to break up the time we spent walking and touring. Close proximity to Istiklal Cad. was a huge plus. Tons of restaurants and shopping. Lovely location. Would book here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gugli
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money, excellent service, parking, breakfast

Reviews.Title: “a bright diamond with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: arashtak
Reviews.Content: hii,a leisure trip with my family and frinds ,we saw very nice view from istanbul that at nights was eye catching, very polite and nice personel that they were very helpful. its location is about 20 meter from isteklal st ,that is so interesting for walking. only i can say ( a hidden jewelery) about this hotel. i have special thanks to mrs ceren yucel the guest maneger and all of its good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, not as good as its Taksim sister”
Reviews.Author: aakunz
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Marmara Taksim, but this time I thought it would be a nice idea to stay at the Marmara Pera. It is 20% cheaper than its Taksim sister hotel. Location is its greatest advantage: away enough from chaotic Taksim, yet close to everything and especially the wonderful Ä°stiklÃ¢l avenue. Even if you have arrived in Taksim with baggage, the hotel is a short hop by metro (ÅžiÅŸhane station). At first sight, it looks uninspiring and ugly from outside at daytime, but its interior looks nice and warm. Front desk is welcoming, knowledgeable, smiling and helpful. Same applies for housekeeping staff. In general, there were smiling faces everywhere. Check-in and check-out were a brisk: no bad surprises and therefore no complaints at all. Thumbs up for the wonderful staff. Rooms are simple and clean. The size is average but the bathroom is somewhat cramped. The lamp mentioned by some members was an issue indeed. Located by the window, looks as if it were put there in order to act as a nice touch for those outside the hotel at night. For those inside is more of an obstacle. Being tall, I didn't find the bathtub to be a problem, but I can understand the concern of people shorter than me. One drawback for me was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities, along with the hotel information book and a mini-bar item price list (I'm not sure if the latter didn't actually exist, but I looked for it without result). Overall, a nice experience but not as good as the Marmara Taksim.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: mariaa77
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 3 nights in the middle of August and i can't find anything to complain about everything was perfectly great !! First of all the location is at the end of istiklal street u can easily take the metro Sishane station 2 min walking distance or the tram 5 min walking distance to get to any part of istanbul and there are taxis available in front of the hotel !! The staff was amazing available to answer all your questions they gave us a map and helped us choosing the cheapest transportation and guided us to the best shopping areas !! We never had to complain about anything ! Breakfast was nice good variety of food ! The room is very modern and had great city view a little bit small but very comfortable ! If i'm going back to istanbul i would definitely stay at marmara pera for a very pleasant stay !

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: macamuy
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to charming bars and restaurants. Good restaurant/bar on the roof called Milka, very trendy. Room with nice view of Bosphoros but quite small. Service could be better, especially at the breakfast - they were quite confused.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: lizsch
Reviews.Content: The location of the Marmara Pera is excellent and convenient to many of the sights in Istanbul. The hotel is also right in front of a taxi stand and ATM machine which I found to be very convenient as well. The room was on the small, but adequate and very clean as were the common areas of the hotel. There is also a rooftop bar and pool area with amazing views of the city that unfortunately we didn't get to take full advantage of because of the weather. All in all, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I don't normally write reviews but after...”
Reviews.Author: Oscar1003
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews but after reading the varying reviews of this hotel, I felt I must. We stayed for 1 week from 21June, and couldn't recommend the hotel highly enough. The staff from the reception, to the pool bar, to the hotel bar and even the room cleaners were lovely. Always there with a smile, greeting and information if you needed it. The only issue we had was one day we came back to the hotel at 4pm to find the room hadn't been cleaned we spoke to reception they apologised and said they would get to it straight away. We popped out for a coffee came back and it was done...less than an hour. The location is perfect for shopping, sightseeing, and the bars, restaurants and nightlife. The rooftop pool is amazing and the view is spectacular. Although the weather wasn't the best, we truly made the most of the pool when we could. Next time we visit Istanbul, we will definately stay at the Marmara Pera.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, fabulous views, great service”
Reviews.Author: Pranavmunim
Reviews.Content: i have been to Istanbul 10 times and always stayed at the Marmara Pera, the service is excellent and good for business and leisure, it is centrally located and not far by bus or tram to the all the tourists spots. a hop away from Taxim which has some great restaurants, pubs and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “great location on the european side of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: shesim
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the marmara pera in june 2010. the location was perfect. it is at one end of the famous pedestrian street ( istiklal cadi ) .. the other end of the street ends at taksim square. for us, this location worked as it was a minutes walk to the main street plus a minutes walk to the funicular which takes you down to the port to cross over from the ' european side ' to the ' asian side '. the rooms were average size with modern decor and were clean and functional with tea coffee making facilities included. the bathrooms too were spacious in comparison to the others i have seen in istanbul. the reception staff were friendly and helpful. the breakfast was huge ! i would recommend this hotel to others. it also has a breathtaking terrace bar which i strongly suggest you visit called MIKLA.

Reviews.Title: “"Well located and well appointed"”
Reviews.Author: Yados73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in Istanbul and have no complaints. The room was on the 12th floor which provided some good views. The room was small and well decorated and the bathroom was a little tired but acceptable. The hotel is in what is a pretty nasty looking building from the outside but the rooms and common areas seemed to have been upgraded so the outside appearance is not a reflection of the interior reality. The roof terrace is small but we managed to get some space to get some sun. The roof top cocktail bar is excellent as is the Mikla restraurants. The hotel is very well located for all the action in Beyoglu. I would give it 3-4 stars and suggest trying it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quality above the average”
Reviews.Author: Zeynobb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with my husband for a long weekend. I already stayed in Sisli Branch of chain of the Marmara Hotels before and this one is better. Location is as good as you may ask for. Walking distance to all Beyoglu attractions yet isolated in the parallel road to Istiklal which makes it more comfortable. Also it has a very efficient taxi station in front which is very important in Istanbul. Rooms were very minimalistic. Nothing fancy about decoration. Especially the lamp hanging from the ceiling was a big decoraton mistake and disturbing by being hit several times I have to say. The hotel personnel was very helpful, well trained and professional. Breakfast was very good. Housekeeping was questionable at least for a hotel of this quality considering the cleaning they make and that a man entered into my room when I was out of shower and didnt need any housekeeping since I just checked in. Also the room was smelling humidity coming from the bathroom all the stay. Overall it is recommendable especially for the location and decency if you are ready to pay bit more for these features.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pinosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marmara Pera for a weekend in April. We had a room overlooking the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus and the view was simply spectacular. What impressed me the most about the hotel was the friendliness of its staff; I don't think I've ever encountered such friendly staff at any other hotel! The room we had was adequate in size, but not very spacious. The oddest thing about our stay was the bathroom door - the bathroom door consisted of two pieces with a gap in between. This meant that you could actually never completely have a closed door! Given the room was for two people, it was rather annoying not having complete privacy in the bathroom. Except for that, the hotel is totally recommendable,

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of the mysterious Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lictorbodrum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pera Marmara Hotel at the beginnig of March and when I travel to Istanbul Pera Marmara is getting my first choice... The location is perfect because if u wanna catch something from ancient city or soul of the Istanbul Pera Marmara is the best choice... If u would like to lose yourself in the ancient city u will feel the spirit of Agatha Christie one step away from u.... She stayed antich Pera hotel which is very close to Pera Marmara and if u r interested with the Turkish foods 5 u will find more than hundered choices around the hotel at AsmalÄ±mescit and IstÄ±klal. Please don't forget visit IstÄ±klal's pubs and bars after the dinner... Hotel is very warm and staff r very professional, rooms and bathrooms r clean, housekeeping working hard and they r very friendly and the lobby is cool for chill... Guest Relation Team r very sensitive for your comfort and they r trying to do their best for serve us a perfect holiday... The team leader Mrs Ceren Yuksel is experienced and perfect lady... I recommend this hotel sharply to every visitor who wanna go to Istanbul....

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location and service”
Reviews.Author: TANYAMRU
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marmara Pera end February 2010 and received such a warm welcome that I just had to write a favourable review - from check-in where I was received by the guest relations manager, Ms Ceren, and throughout my stay. the level of service was excellent. The hotel itself is very well located since it is a five minutes walk to the famous Istiklal Street and also very conveniently close to the metro which takes you to most of the shopping malls around Taksim. The room was quite big and comfortable for Istanbul and the bathroom although small was adequate. Would recommend a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: SoleilCanada
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed for 4 nights and loved it. The rooms are modern and clean. The staff is very professional and accommodating. The location is fantastic, only steps away from great shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: RichardJarnefelt
Reviews.Content: I must say I was surprised - a good and modern hotel with a great old time service! Me and my fiancÃ© were happy and well taken care in any needs we had, and those services were usually even free! The location is also perfect, so when you come to Istanbul, remember Marmara Pera! :)

Reviews.Title: “A good 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: cevdet1946
Reviews.Content: Vi stayed att the 17th flor and had 3 rooms next to each other. Fantastic view both at daytime and at night. Especially the view of The Bridge with color changing lights was very nice. Rooms are nice and very clean. Clean bathroom but a very high edge for the baththub. It was really "dangerous" to climb in and out. The breakfast was very good. Location is very good . Walking distance to Taksim and Tunel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Low Quality - aweful - not all rooms are of equal quality”
Reviews.Author: JuliaJackman
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last night. The receptionists keep lying to the customers for some reason. The day before I went there personally to make a reservation I asked for a room on the higher floors and they confirmed. The next day we arrived they said that they were full and didn't have any rooms left on the higher floors. They gave us a room on the 5th floor saying they had no other rooms available I objected then they said "well, if thats what we said yesterday then i will give you a room on the higher floors" like he was doing me a favour. When just a second ago he said he had no rooms. This was no favour as this is what we had paid for in advance and was confirmed by them. We went up to our room and it was freezing, the carpets and bed, sheets etc. were very damp. Actually the entire room was damp and cold. Stepping on the damp carpet with bare feet was a disgusting experience. I was very upset and disappointed when I saw the room. No where near 4 star quality! The sheets were sort of dirty and the towels were barely white. We went downstairs to complain. They said they would try to heat the room and if we weren't happy they would change it. Even if the room did heat up it would have to be warm for more than a week to dry up the dampness in the room. After some insistance they agreed to change the room. The room we were given was totally different - dry and warm and of better quality. I wonder why they deliberately gave us such a bad room in the first place, made such a bad impression and caused us a hassle. The receptionists are kind yet condescending and lying out of their teeth. I will never stay here again and never advise anyone that i know to stay here. There are much nicer hotels in Istanbul that treat their customers with respect. Shame on Marmara Pera for ruining the good name the Marmara has.

Reviews.Title: “Really awful experience”
Reviews.Author: darioraj
Reviews.Content: I've been reading reviews and it has really good ones, but I want to tell you the experience I lived a while ago. We are a family of 4 and we have a really awful experience. First of all, the sheets from boths bedrooms (we booked two double rooms) had holes in several places. In one of the rooms we had only one glass, and the curtains of both rooms were teared apart. Later on, due to a confusion with our travel agency, both double bedrooms didn't include breakfast (which we thought they did, cause we already find it quite expensive after taking a look at the rooms). We did not know that, we found out when we had poor coffee into a cup, and not even given a sip and one of the waiters passes by and drops with quite bad attitude the check on the table. Right away we went to the reception to tell them our fee was with breakfast, but apparently it wasn't and they wanted to charge us the whole breakfast (the one we didn't take, and including 4 people when 1 of us was still in the room having a shower). Instead of settling something up, like we expect due to confusion that was made and the quality of the hotel, the manager called the waiter to ask him if we had taken a sip of the coffee or not to see weather to charge us or not, cause they said we were stealing from them... A real shame for a 5 star hotel, who charge that much for a room and have that kind of bad attention to the customers, calling them lyers, and instead of charging the coffee or settle something, calling the waiter to "testify"... I've never had that experience in my life, and even less in that kind of quality hotel. A piece of advise, if you really want a nice hotel and you appreciate the location of the marmara pera hotel, just 50 metres away you have the pera suites, we stayed there and it was marvellous, the boutique hotel is a beauty and the attention and good mood of the environment is priceless (and of course, it was half the price we were paying for the marmara pera)

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: MrMidland
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay here. Perfect location, helpful staff, clean and stylish rooms, fantastic views of Istanbul etc. etc. I am going to stay here again next time!

Reviews.Title: “What a Lovely Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: portuguesa
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, close to everything. The staff is sincerely friendly and helpful. The rooms are brightly lit with views of either the neighborhood or the Marmara Sea. We loved our stay here. We cannot speak a word of Turkish, but the friendly staff was careful to put us into a cab and instruct the driver where to take us. (Unscrupulous cab drivers--and there are many--do not stop at the Marmara, as they know they are not welcome nor tolerated). The included breakfast was large, had plenty of healthy alternatives, and was delicious. The workout facilities were very good. The restaurant on the top floor is not affiliated with the hotel, but is very good, albeit expensive. Highly recommended place to stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “if I'm coming back to Istanbul I'm definitely gonna stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: leetoonastic
Reviews.Content: great location, fabulous area with lots of hip restaurants and also local small cafes. very modern hotel, lovely room, comfortable bed, amazing view to Bosforus and the rest of the city. small but nice rooftop pool, fabulous view. we absolutly loved it!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION...”
Reviews.Author: PATRIACH
Reviews.Content: Very Good Location... No other hotel could be in a better location for fun & night life...

Reviews.Title: “Modern try with good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Aksel
Reviews.Content: Decent upper class hotel, 3+ I would say, that are trying to cater to the experienced hotel guest with a modern look, but in my sense, it falls short to the finish line in lack of certain things in service and quality. I would still say itâ€™s a good and clean hotel and it gives you value for your money. Location 6/10: Located in Galatasaray area (Tepebasi), the biggest advantage the hotel has, is its location at the beginning of the shopping street Istiklal caddesi, which is an all walking street, with many shops and restaurants. This street ends up at Taksim square, where you can take the metro, taxis, busess, etc.. The hotel is also quite close to the old part, where all the sightseeing places are; The Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, The palace and of course the covered bazaar. The area have some really good restaurants, especially the very famous and popular Mikla, which is owned and run by the Swedish/Turkish chef Mehemt GÃ¼rs. Splendid food and atmosphere, as well as view, but very difficult to get a table. Book well in advance. In the summer time their patio is amazing to dine at. Access to taxis are very good, since they small station is placed outside the hotel. Lobby/Check-in 7/10: The entrance and lobby is modern and sleek. Good seating area beside it and the staff is very friendly and help full. They knew a lot of tourist information, or they would find it for you. Umbrellas to loan if needed.. The lobby is a bit small, but its not a very big hotel, but the lobby can get a bit crowded. Had in advanced asked for a room on the higher floors, and I got it at the top. Room 6/10: Modern rooms but not the best of quality on the internal decoration and furniture. Good size room, but only one chair to sit in, for a double room. The view was amazing and the windows were able to open, to get some fresh air, but only a bit, so it was safe. The bed was very comfortable and big. A quite big flat screen TV, but mostly Turkish channels and only two English speaking. No pay movies to choose from if you were staying in, that is big minus. No radio possibility neither. Safe deposit box in the room was good. Cleaning was perfect, but they missed a few times to refill or take away half used products, such as shampoo. The bathroom was very small (see photo) and I could not sit on the toilet without having to be forced to close the door. Also, the bathtub side was quite high, so for young kids or older people, it might be a big hazardous or dangerous to get in and out, since there was no bathtub protection mat or something similar not to slip when standing and showering. The last, and minor minus, was that they used very cheap products for showering and body lotion. No brand at all and they did not smell all that well. Some negative things were that it was quite good sound proofing, so you could here people talking or the TV in other rooms or when a door was shut, as well as the sound for when the elevator arrived at that floor. There were no slippers or bathrobe. One of the major misses was the lack of an information booklet. You had no idea when breakfast was served, TV-channels, which floor the gym is on, etc.. You had to call the front desk all the time. Restaurants 9/10: This is almost as good as it gets. Mehmet GÃ¼rs restaurants are famous in Turkey, and it should be an honour to have it in your hotel. Located at the roof, with an outside patio for the summer time. I did not get to try it this time, but I have been at all his other restaurants many time, since itâ€™s a friends cousin from Sweden, and we have never been even the slightest disappointed. Its been exquisite very time. Very modern and cool setting, with dark wood and black decoration. The bar is a bit small, but ok. The wine selection is very good. The breakfast had a very good selection, with an extra menu if you wanted something special, like many kind of omelettes or a special kind of coffee, for example. What was not good, was that there were no small signs, explaining what everything contained, like there were ten different cheese with different contents, but no explanation of what. When asked, they had an explanation that the counter was new, â€œhow new? One month.â€� and they had not had the time to fix that yet. Itâ€™s a bit small for the number of rooms they have, so it can get very crowded on the weekends, and here is one minus; the staff got less service minded the more people there were. Other: There is complimentary high speed internet access in the rooms, which is good and worked excellent. They also have a small business center with internet. The gym was small and did not contain much of equipment, but did not try it, just looked inside. The bar is long with many seats, but there were only two groups of chairs and tables. They had a big screen TV with â€œa thousand channelsâ€�, but they did only know two of them, and I asked three different bar tenders and none could help or write down the channels as a service for others that will ask. Overall itâ€™s a good value hotel. Good price for Istanbul with a modern touch. The staff is friendly and try, sometimes, but fall short on intelligence to think for themselves to try to evolve their knowledge of their job.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad...”
Reviews.Author: Dagsy81
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a great location near the shops, metro, taxis and great restaurants, The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The only downside is that i didnt quite feel like i was in a 5 star hotel. I would never opt for this hotel if i was travelling for leisure - as the price is too high for what you get. Also its very noisy on the weekends due to the proximity of the nightclubs - we were on the 7th floor.. perhaps its not as bad if you are higher up. The restaurant/bar on the top floor is stunning and worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location and view!”
Reviews.Author: patrickMontreal
Reviews.Content: I was staying at this hotel for 3 nights, it is true the rooms are basic for the price and I wasn't too impressed until I went upstairs on the terrace. The view at the sunset is UNBELIEVABLE!!!!!The resto is really nice too, and the food really good. If you go in summer time, you will definitely enjoy spending time on the roof toop, having drinks at the bar and in the swimming pool with the spectacular view. And you walk one block and you are right at the Istiklal street, but at the opposite side of Taksim square so you can walk to the sultanameth district easy...you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel, Great Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: travellingaussie62
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in April with my teenage son. The staff couldnt have been more helpful and pleasant (and they spoke excellent english which was a real bonus). The location was great(very close to main shopping precinct) with plenty of options for great varieties in delicious, cheap cafes. The room was plenty big enough, with no problems with plumbing or air-conditioning/heating. The view from our room looking towards Taksim Square was great, and the view from the roof was 360 degrees and absolutely spectacular. It was the only time in Istanbul that we got a real perspective how the city was laid out. I would recommend it to anyone and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location in the new city”
Reviews.Author: Terry_in_Victoria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located centrally in the new city. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. The rooms were clean and decent. We had a room with a great view of the city. For what we paid for the hotel it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Tries to be upmarket - alas saved by efficient service”
Reviews.Author: luxebabe
Reviews.Content: Photos of the hotel looked rather impressive online. However, upon check-in, the room falls short of expectations. First of all, no doubt it has been recently renovated and everything was 'new-ish'. But there are still traces of it being really rundown once upon a time. I can't put my finger on it, but it feels not all that spanking new! We were told of a 'fitness center' and 'pool on the roof'. Only to find out the fitness center is nothing more than a sweaty gutted out hotel room on the 2nd floor. And the 'pool' was nothing more than a dipping pool with a view. Our room had a fantastic view of Golden Horn and the City. But the experience was spoiled by a few nagging things. Firstly, housekeeping wasn't as meticulous as I'd expect. The sheets we tucked way deep on one end and flopping out on the other. Made it really uncomfortable to sleep in as other person in the bed always had the short side. Bath tub is really narrow and the side is just too high. Made it really precarious (especially being pregnant) climbing out after a shower. To make matters worse, the air-conditioning broke down in the middle of the night and we were left to sweat it out until someone could attend to it at 6am. BUT, the management made up swiftly for it by offering us a fruit plate and complimentary meal at the cafe. Best part of the Marmara Pera, is Mikla - its swanky Swedish Turkish restaurant on the top floor with roof garden. Highlight of our stay was watching the sunset from the roof with cocktails. If it wasn't for the professional yet friendly and efficient staff, the entire stay would have been a disaster. If you've never visited Istanbul and want to stay here, do it only for its convenience to Istiklal (shopping street). But seen Istiklal once, and it's enough. Stay in the Taksim area instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with stunning view”
Reviews.Author: Le0ncin0
Reviews.Content: Main advantages: Best view of the Golden Horn, Sultanhamet and Bosphorus. Fabulous roof bar. You must have a drink at sun set or dusk! We chose this hotel for its convenient location and swimming pool. Comments about the rooms from other Tripadvisor members are confirmed. They are comfortable and clean, though impersonal. The decoration could be improved, to match the fabulous view! The plus: We have been welcomed and attended by one of the best Receptionist we long have encountered! We wish those of you who have booked a room there, to get the same excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “A decent and well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: yeldes
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our trip to Istanbul and the thing that helped us enjoy it was our good choice of the hotel. Marmara Pera is located very close to Istiklal street, only 3 walking minutes. Also, the bus station,Sishane, is right next to the hotel and no need to walk till taksim square to ride the bus. Furthermore, the tram station was right behind the hotel. The rooms were very clean. We booked two rooms, a double and a triple one. The double bedroom was very good, yet the other room with three beds seemed to be full and no place for us to move freely inside the room. Otherwise, the breakfast was very delicious and full of different varities. The staff were very polite and nice. The wireless internet connection was available for free. I believe that it is more economical for toursits to visit the Dolma bahce, blue mosque and Aya Sophia on their own instead of subscribing through the travel agency. No need to take a cab as the buses are very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Location and views the high points”
Reviews.Author: Catfordkiz
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal and room upgrade through work. Our 11th-floor room overlooked the Golden Horn and we could see the Bosphorus with Karakoy's cruise ships in the distance. It was a good size and spotlessly clean. Other positives: the gorgeous rooftop bar, though curiously it seemed to be closed at 5/6pm, precisely when we would have enjoyed a post-sightseeing pick-me-up breakfast complete with oozing honeycomb sheet, mmm...; the location too cannot be faulted. Negatives: staff were a little cold, but this is nothing unique to the Marmara Pera, lots of the "business" hotels in Istanbul are like that. The bar staff upstairs deserve a special mention for being downright snotty. It wouldn't put me off staying here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great views from the roof top pool & bar”
Reviews.Author: sisli
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights in Marmara Pera. The room was clean and cool deco. The bathroom was clean and normal size. Air condition in the room worked well enough. The staff was friendly, polite and spoke good english. The internet connection downstairs was slow just like in the 90's. Some noise at night from the bar next to the hotel. The minibar was over priced, but there are small shops 20meters from the hotel. There are several nice cafes and bars near the hotel. Great location only a block from Beyoglu mainstreet Istiklail Caddesi. A new metro station Sishane about a block away . Good connections all in all. We paid about 90 euros a night without breakfast, so i have to say this was a great deal. Oh and the pool and bar had the best views ever.

Reviews.Title: “AN OVERRATED BALLOON”
Reviews.Author: EPIRUS28
Reviews.Content: Marmara Pera hotel , tries to show itself as an upmarket - hip- cool- urban hotel , the truth is, it is far from being any kind of hip. It has the ugliest architecture, second to the monstrous state TV bulding in a very nice part of Ä°stanbul famous for its beautiful architecture. If you want to live a truly retro atmosphere, you can try staying there for a night and feel yourself embraced by soulless interior design from 1970s. Even the so called duvets are from 70's hotels. That is, take 2 pieces of bed sheet, put a horrible brown blanket in between and wrap it around the bed. Voila ! A cool hotel room :) I am a keen traveller and have been to many hotels in my life. The only hotel I waited in a queve just to get a table for breakfast is Pera Marmara. The price? High for what you get. Istanbul has lots and lots of top class hotels, nice interesting small hotels, wonderful palace hotels. But it also has a couple of hotels which are like Pera Marmara, trying to portray themselves as sophisticated-cool and ask for high amounts of money. I would look for other options in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not sure on the price”
Reviews.Author: mr_peterman
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel as a part of a tour that I was on. The hotel seemed pretty good. The reception and lobby was kept well, although the prices were through the roof!! A beer was 11TL!! The rooms were a decent size, however the bath rooms were very small. I would say this hotel should be a 3 star though. Compared to some of the other hotels I stayed at in Turkey - which were 3 star - this hotels rooms were marginally better. The location though is excellent. I am not sure how much the room was though, so I cannot give my opinion there. If I had to guess, you could probably find better hotels around Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “good location but definitely not a four star”
Reviews.Author: movin_around
Reviews.Content: Marmara Pera was in a great location, but not worth any expensive rates in my opinion. The hotel rooms were quite small, especially for family. but they were clean and comfortable otherwise. The hotel is perfectly located near Istiklal street, maybe a 10-15 minute walk to Taksim square. A cab ride to the Grand bazaar and Sultanahmet area didn't take more than 15 minutes so that was good. Service was just average, with the response time varying during the time of day. The day we were checking out seemed busy, room service was terribly slow. The rooftop bar is definitely worth a visit, even if you're staying in another hotel closeby. Great views and relaxed atmosphere, DJ wasn't that bad. All-in-all, if you're looking for a short trip to just see the sights and have a good time, Marmara Pera is an okay choice. It is important to be near Taksim square. If you're looking for a romantic getaway, i wouldn't recommend it Get the sea view room, otherwise the only view you will have is rooftops, it seemed to be one the tallest buildings in the area.

Reviews.Title: “great location, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpr2exs
Reviews.Content: Its not too hard to get to. in front of the turkish radio and tv station, with a taxi rank infront of it, just off istiklal caddesi, plenty of restaurants and shops around the corner. most rooms have a view of some sort. we were lucky to have a high floor. views were towards the north. bathroom was unsual in that there were mirrors on the ceiling too. good if you like looking at yourself from all angles. plenty of toiletries provided. comfortable bed and reasonably spacious. business centre downstairs has computer with printers for use.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: torosworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at 2006 (after two weeks its grand opening) The hotel was new and everything seems ok. The rooms, view are good. However the hotel did not have car parking area. I came to hotel with my car, the doormen open the my door and ask if I need to park. I said "yes, I am a hotel customer." He took my car without any notice. Two days later, after my c-out I request my car from the doorman. My car came with a person, who is not a hotel staff, the doorman said, we have no parking area and we gave your car any place that we can find. The stranger man request from me 180 Eur for two days parking fee. I refused it and I request help from the reception, recetion says, its not our responsibility, no one help me from the hotel. I bargain to parking man and I gave 100 Euro. I wrote a mail to hotel manager, but no one call me back. I never refer this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with views on Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: Izikr
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with excellent service and clean rooms. We booked a room with the view on Bosphorus. The only thing that we did not like so much was a smaller than we expected room. Breakfast was not included and would cost for over 20 euros per person.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Beyoglu, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: wildrat
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days in Marmara Pera hotel, the view over istanbul is marvelous, and in the hotel is wireless internet,(free)the big lcd screen has 3types of pcconnection. 5minutes walking towards the shoppingstreet with the old red tram. Even their is nearly everywhere wireless internet supported by beyoglu. Taksim square is 10 minutes walking. The terrace in front of the hotel is the big TRTterrace where you have a splendid view over the sun going down with the silhouette of the famous topkapi all the way round to ataturkbridge. If you like to stay luxury and very near main shopping good terrace a 360degrees restaurant on top 21th floor of Marmara Pera(reserve 1day ahead), note their are 3 hotels of the Marmara group in Istanbul, Beyoglu,Taksim The Marmara 5* hotel is at taksim square. Then their is Marmara Pera and a third Marmara hotel(seems to me for big conferentiongroups extra space) I've been 5times to Istanbul and this hotel was superior in every way,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGal62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location...you can walk to the shopping district and easily get around from here. Rooftop lounge and pool are fabulous and had one of the best meals in Istanbul at the Mikla Restaurant! Rooms are in a funky, minimalist style.

Reviews.Title: “Big let down”
Reviews.Author: passport76
Reviews.Content: This really is a well located but very overpriced 3 star hotel, and not a well maintained one at that. The staff were friendly, but all seemed inexperienced and incapable of doing anything and no one follow up on our complaints as promised. The rooms are modern in design and very small, especially the bathroom, which was finished in cheap tiles and dirty grouting. The amenities were not in good order, the keys didn't work, we replaced ours four times in two days, the mini bar was warm, the air conditioning was pathetic and the hair dryer... just hot air. We ordered up an iron and ironing board but the iron was scolded and unusable. Our request for a non smoking room was not met. There was hair in the bath! The bath products were cheap and nasty. All of this I would accept for a fraction of the price, but at 248 euros a night, it was daylight robbery. The bar and restaurants on the top floors do have amazing views and are well worth a visit, but pity the rooms underneath, as the outdoor bar plays very loud music through to the small hours and staying on a high floor we couldn't sleep. The roof top pool is the size of a plunge pool, and being two young ladies we never felt comfortable enough to get into our swim wear or sunbathe as it is in such close proximity to the bar and the poser type of clientele it attracts. Not a nice place to stay.This really is a well located but very overpriced 3 star hotel, and not a well maintained one at that. The staff were friendly, but all seemed inexperienced and incapable of doing anything and no one follow up on our complaints as promised. The rooms are modern in design and very small, especially the bathroom, which was finished in cheap tiles and dirty grouting. The amenities were not in good order, the keys didn't work, we replaced ours four times in two days, the mini bar was warm, the air conditioning was pathetic and the hair dryer... just hot air. We ordered up an iron and ironing board but the iron was scolded and unusable. Our request for a non smoking room was not met. There was hair in the bath! The bath products were cheap and nasty. All of this I would accept for a fraction of the price, but at 248 euros a night, it was daylight robbery. The bar and restaurants on the top floors do have amazing views and are well worth a visit, but pity the rooms underneath, as the outdoor bar plays very loud music through to the small hours and staying on a high floor we couldn't sleep. The roof top pool is the size of a plunge pool, and being two young ladies we never felt comfortable enough to get into our swim wear or sunbathe as it is in such close proximity to the bar and the poser type of clientele it attracts. Not a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modest, but nice”
Reviews.Author: Aceq
Reviews.Content: Nicely placed hotel, clean rooms, although a notch smaller than i expected. The hotel was built rather recently with a decent interior design. Liked: location, service (they brought in a basket of fruits since it was my birthday - nice touch), cleanness of rooms, breakfast Disliked: poor on amenities (no pool, spa, etc), rather pricey for what you get Don't be confused with Marmara hotel, which is 10-15 minutes away. Marmara Pera is a new addition to the Marmara collection. Would I stay here again? Well, I've booked Hyatt Regency for my next trip that starts tomorrow, so... and the price is almost the same. I will write a review about Hyatt after I return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice views, poor room quality”
Reviews.Author: ik71
Reviews.Content: The Marmara Pera is located in Beyoglu and has nice views to the old city and the sea. That's the good thing about it. We stayed for 3 nights and payed 180â‚¬ per night without breakfast which was way too expensive for the quality of the rooms. The size and the ambience of the rooms are typical for a 3-star hotel with rate no more than 100 euros / night.

Reviews.Title: “big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: kbtmom
Reviews.Content: Big disappoint after having spent several nights at the Dersaadet Hotel across the Golden Horn. My sister had a business meeting and I went along as her travelling companion. From the moment we walked into the lobby and were ignored, we wanted to pack up and leave. No one ever offered to help us with our luggage or were able to give us directions when we needed them. Toilet paper was missing from our room. Did have nice view of the northern city skyline but located in a very noisy neighborhood. Lots of traffic all night long. Glad I wasn't paying for it.

HotelInfo.Name: The Marmara Pera Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Mesrutiyet Caddesi Tepebasi, Istanbul 34430, Turkey
